definitions: Potassium nitrate, a white crystalline substance, used in gunpowder, as a fertilizer, and in medicine.
Sodium nitrate, a white crystalline substance, used as a fertilizer and in the manufacture of explosives.
examples: Saltpeter is a key ingredient in gunpowder.
Farmers use saltpeter as a fertilizer.
Historically, saltpeter was used to preserve meat.
